comment: Two ways to express that a set ` A ` (not necessarily a function) is one-to-one. Each side is equivalent to Definition 6.4(3) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 24, who use the notation "Un_2 (A)" for one-to-one. We do not introduce a separate notation since we rarely use it. (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-2004.)
